meanings.sent1: The slimy, mucose frog hopped along the pond.
meanings.sent2: Her mucose hands slipped on the wet railing.
meanings.sent3: The mucose sidewalk made walking feel like skating.
meanings.sent4: The mucose walls of the cave glistened in the dim light.
meanings.sent5: The mucose texture of the jellyfish was fascinating to touch.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or resembling mucus.
meanings.sent1: The mucose substance on the leaf attracted insects.
meanings.sent2: The mucose smell in the room indicated a leak somewhere.
meanings.sent3: The mucose consistency of the soup made it hard to swallow.
meanings.sent4: The mucose appearance of the slime mold puzzled the scientists.
meanings.sent5: The mucose nature of the slime made it difficult to clean up.
